page.title: 02MAYSIDE RECLAMATION
page.content: Mayside Reclamation collects waste paper which is then sent to England to paper mills to be recycled. This is the only firm of it's kind in the Channel Islands. They employ 4 people,the warehouse is rented and the machines are 2nd hand.There are 23 bins around the Island.The waste paper is cut into small pieces,then shredded and put into bales of half a ton. There are 5 grades of paper.The card board is sorted out and baled,and the newsprint is separated and baled. One fiftieth of the wastepaper is dumped because it is full of rubbish. The firm is situated in St.Sampson's as it is an industrial area,and it is away from houses because of the risk of fire and the{health hazard}caused by rats, wild cats, and paper flying around.
